This game is incredibly fun, competitive, and I constantly come back to it. Though that isn't why CSGO is so special to me. The community has defined the person that I am today. Being able to talk to strangers every day for 1-2 hours and having to deal and work with a variety of personalities has greatly increased my social skills. Sometimes you hop on to community servers just to talk about anything. Automation? Politics? Crude humor? People being artistic? All of these can be found. My point is that at surface value, this is an addictive and competitive shooter, but to me, it is a community that greatly made me the person that I am.
Csgo is one of the most fun games ever played but can make a person want to end it, all at the same time
